title: 2007 Canadian Grand Prix
summary: The 2007 Canadian Grand Prix (formally the Formula 1 Grand Prix du Canada 2007)[2] was a Formula One motor race held on 10 June 2007 at Circuit Gilles Villeneuve in Montreal, Quebec, Canada.[3] It was the sixth race of the 2007 Formula One World Championship. The race was won by Lewis Hamilton, starting from pole position, in his first season in the top formula. It was Hamilton's first of an eventual record breaking 102 victories in Formula One. Nick Heidfeld finished second and Alexander Wurz was third, making it the first Grand Prix of the 2007 season that drivers from teams other than Ferrari and McLaren achieved podium positions.
